qas.question: What is a reason a DJ would prefer vinyl to CD?
In what techniques would a DJ require a vinyl record?
Are all turn tables capable of DJ manipulation of vinyl records?

answers.text: provided the stylus, record player, and record itself are built to withstand it

qas.question: What is commonly preferred by DJs vinyl or CD?

answers.text: any electronic dance music and hip hop releases today are still preferred on vinyl
However, many CDJ and DJ advances, such as DJ software and time-encoded vinyl, now have these capabilities and more.

context: M<a3_0>any electronic dance music and hip hop releases today are still preferred on vinyl<a3_0/>; however, digital copies are still widely available. This is because for disc jockeys ("DJs"), vinyl has an advantage over the CD: <a0_0>direct manipulation<a0_0/> of the medium. DJ techniques such as <a1_0>slip-cueing, beatmatching, and scratching<a1_0/> originated on turntables. With CDs or compact audio cassettes one normally has only indirect manipulation options, e.g., the play, stop, and pause buttons. With a record one can place the stylus a few grooves farther in or out, accelerate or decelerate the turntable, or even reverse its direction, <a2_0>provided the stylus, record player, and record itself are built to withstand it<a2_0/>. <a4_0>However, many CDJ and DJ advances, such as DJ software and time-encoded vinyl, now have these capabilities and more.
